subject: Leadership
title: Stakeholder Ethics
description: A fast breakdown of Stakeholder Ethics for builders.

hook.text: Shareholders want profits. Employees want security. Communities want responsibility. Who does the leader serve?

buildup.text: Freeman's stakeholder theory: companies owe duties to all affected parties, not just shareholders. Ethics is balancing.

discovery.text: Stakeholder ethics asks: who is affected by this decision and how? It expands the moral circle beyond the bottom line.

twist.text: Ignoring stakeholders isn't just unethical. It's risky. Communities boycott. Employees quit. Regulators investigate.

climax.text: Map stakeholders before deciding. Ask whose interests are served and whose are sacrificed. Then choose with intention.

punchline.text: A leader who serves only shareholders serves nobody for long.

quiz.question: What does stakeholder theory argue about corporate duties?
options: Companies owe duties to all parties affected by their decisions
